<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Assured Identification](/Feats.aspx?ID=6462) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=615" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=695" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 227 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Prerequisites**
Expert in [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=35), Expert in [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43), Expert in [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=44), or Expert in [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)

</column>

---

You rarely [misidentify](/Rules.aspx?ID=3245)  an item. When using Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion checks to [Identify Magic](/Actions.aspx?ID=2365), if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead. If you would misidentify a[cursed](/Traits.aspx?ID=567) item because you roll a success but not a critical success (GM Core 306), you simply can't identify it instead.
